replies.body: yeh ok but wheres the rest of the chat log seriously tired of trolls and abusive players and then i have been through the other 3 tiers but i still see players that are far worse then me.  broken system is broken, and forever more will be!

> [{quoted}](name=ForStSpyda,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=j1A7EdpN,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-02-19T00:28:45.570+0000)

As a community, **we also don't believe that retaliation is an appropriate response, so in cases where there is retaliation, both players receive penalties.** This is the only warning this account will receive. Further examples of toxic behavior can result in permanent closure of your account.

As stated in the email you received (outlined in my quote) retaliation is not an appropriate response. When they look at your reports, they will look at you as an individual and your individual behaviour within the game, hence why you only get your chat log. As it stands, your behaviour (regardless of what the other players have said or done) is not acceptable.

They will also be up on the block and will be punished for their actions, but just because they said or did something bad, does not give you right to retaliate with these kinds of responses. In the heat of a game, it could be very difficult to ignore toxic players, but in the future do mute them and use the reporting functions so they get punished for their behaviour.

Definitely take this as a learning experience, as it is your last warning, any further punishments will result in a permanent ban as per the 4 tier punishment system;

* 10 game chat restriction
* 25 game chat restriction
* 14 day account ban
* Permanent account ban

First of all, it's really good that you are posting here to try and understand why this is happening.

As Lemon Hunter mentioned, you will only receive your own chat in the logs that you were sent.

In the case of the chat log you have linked, you're verbally abusing your team mates and the other logs you were sent will also show this. It's also not the first time you have been picked up by the system. You've been given 2 chat restrictions and now the 14 Day ban. 

If you don't reform your behaviour you're going to end up permanently banned, so as tough as it can be at times, you really need to think about how you are interacting with other players.

> In the case of the chat log you have linked, you're verbally abusing your team mates and the other logs you were sent will also show this. It's also not the first time you have been picked up by the system. You've been given 2 chat restrictions and now the 14 Day ban. 
> 
> If you don't reform your behaviour you're going to end up permanently banned, so as tough as it can be at times, you really need to think about how you are interacting with other players.

Looking at behaviour without looking at the context that behaviour is housed within is not only moronic, it's borderline illegal.  Not a single court of law would condemn a person based on their actions alone without consideration for circumstances.  At the very least it's unethical for your company to do that.

On top of that, your system is fundamentally flawed.  Is it OK to abuse someone?  No, it's not, but your system encourages trolling through _behaviour_.  As it stands someone can knowingly troll your game and take your jungle, push your lane, auto attack minions, buy ridiculous items, suicide to buffs, build AP Riven etc etc etc - and all of those things are perfectly fine as long as they don't say a word, because as long as they're not abusive in chat, their behaviour is perfectly fine in the current system.

I have to say, also, that you're teaching millions of people how to incorrectly deal with difficult circumstances in real life.  There is no report function in real life, there is no mute in real life, there is no attempting to permanently ban people from real life (unless you get a restraining order or something, but even then, people who get permanently banned in-game just make new accounts anyway, so it doesn't work), so what exactly are you teaching all of these kids who play your game when it comes to conflict resolution?  Absolutely nothing.

 I have as much of an issue with douchebags and abusive people in games as the next person, but your system is fundamentally flawed, and permanently banning people achieves nothing.

It absolutely does and I've witnessed it countless, countless times playing this game.

As LemonHunter and DTN have said, the official stance is that regardless of reason that kind of behaviour is unacceptable. If they demonstrated unacceptable behaviour then they will face punishment for it as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=j1A7EdpN,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-19T08:57:29.865+0000)
>
> As LemonHunter and DTN have said, the official stance is that regardless of reason that kind of behaviour is unacceptable. If they demonstrated unacceptable behaviour then they will face punishment for it as well.

That's actually not true.  If they demonstrated unacceptable typing skills (abusive chat), yes, they will be punished, but unacceptable behaviour?  No, they absolutely will not, unless its in conjunction with the typing skills.

Cases of intentionally feeding/trolling and other negative in game behaviour will be reviewed by PB specialists if the case is ambiguous; So yes, they will face punishment for those actions. 

Given that OP made a point of their chat not being there as well I would think much of their negative behaviour would be present there.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=j1A7EdpN,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-02-25T02:25:24.946+0000)
>
> Cases of intentionally feeding/trolling and other negative in game behaviour will be reviewed by PB specialists if the case is ambiguous; So yes, they will face punishment for those actions. 
> 
> Given that OP made a point of their chat not being there as well I would think much of their negative behaviour would be present there.

You have no way of proving that someone is intentionally or unintentionally trolling without negative chat or a full match history of 0-13-0 with mobi boots.  NO way of proving that.

There are cues and hints in the data they receive that is pretty good at pointing out if it is a legitimate report or not, including things like report history of those players reporting and the consistency of the accused. Detailed descriptions of the behaviour that match up or overlap in the comments of the report also are a good way to know. (Troll reports don't usually bother with comments at all).

There are plenty of ways of proving it. It's not infallible, and some do slip through, but it's not as hard as you might think. And more often than not it IS tied to chat logs.

They will be judged according to their actions only just as you are judged for yours and noone elses. The only player you can control is yourself. If you are having a problem with what someone else is saying, please mute them. Getting into an argument will only exacerbate the problem, and the other players will be bothered by you just the same.
